name: util.types
summary:
util.types provides type checks for different kinds of built-in objects. Unlike instanceof or Object.prototype.toString.call(value), these checks do not inspect properties of the object that are accessible from JavaScript (like their prototype), and usually have the overhead of calling into C++.

The result generally does not make any guarantees about what kinds of properties or behavior a value exposes in JavaScript. They are primarily useful for addon developers who prefer to do type checking in JavaScript.

methods.name: isAnyArrayBuffer
methods.summary:
Returns true if the value is a built-in ArrayBuffer or SharedArrayBuffer instance.

See also util.types.isArrayBuffer() and util.types.isSharedArrayBuffer().

methods.name: isArgumentsObject
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is an arguments object.

methods.name: isArrayBuffer
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in ArrayBuffer instance. This does not include SharedArrayBuffer instances. Usually, it is desirable to test for both; See util.types.isAnyArrayBuffer() for that.

methods.name: isArrayBufferView
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is an instance of one of the ArrayBuffer views, such as typed array objects or DataView. Equivalent to ArrayBuffer.isView().

methods.name: isAsyncFunction
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is an async function. This only reports back what the JavaScript engine is seeing; in particular, the return value may not match the original source code if a transpilation tool was used.

methods.name: isBigInt64Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a Bigint64Array instance.

methods.name: isBigUint64Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a BigUint64Array instance.

methods.name: isBooleanObject
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a boolean object, e.g. created by new Boolean().

methods.name: isBoxedPrimitive
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is any boxed primitive object, e.g. created by new Boolean(), new String() or Object(Symbol()).

methods.name: isDataView
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in DataView instance.

methods.name: isDate
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Date instance.

methods.name: isFloat32Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Float32Array instance.

methods.name: isFloat64Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Float64Array instance.

methods.name: isGeneratorFunction
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a generator function. This only reports back what the JavaScript engine is seeing; in particular, the return value may not match the original source code if a transpilation tool was used.

methods.name: isGeneratorObject
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a generator object as returned from a built-in generator function. This only reports back what the JavaScript engine is seeing; in particular, the return value may not match the original source code if a transpilation tool was used.

methods.name: isInt16Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Int16Array instance.

methods.name: isInt32Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Int32Array instance.

methods.name: isInt8Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Int8Array instance.

methods.name: isMap
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Map instance.

methods.name: isMapIterator
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is an iterator returned for a built-in Map instance.

methods.name: isNativeError
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is an instance of a built-in Error type.

methods.name: isNumberObject
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a number object, e.g. created by new Number().

methods.name: isPromise
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Promise.

methods.name: isRegExp
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a regular expression object.

methods.name: isSet
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Set instance.

methods.name: isSetIterator
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is an iterator returned for a built-in Set instance.

methods.name: isSharedArrayBuffer
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in SharedArrayBuffer instance. This does not include ArrayBuffer instances. Usually, it is desirable to test for both; See util.types.isAnyArrayBuffer() for that.

methods.name: isStringObject
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a string object, e.g. created by new String().

methods.name: isSymbolObject
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a symbol object, created by calling Object() on a Symbol primitive.

methods.name: isTypedArray
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in TypedArray instance.

methods.name: isUint16Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Uint16Array instance.

methods.name: isUint32Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Uint32Array instance.

methods.name: isUint8Array
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Uint8Array instance.

methods.name: isUint8ClampedArray
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in Uint8ClampedArray instance.

methods.name: isWeakMap
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in WeakMap instance.

methods.name: isWeakSet
methods.summary: Returns true if the value is a built-in WeakSet instance.
